channel.title: development on Aaron McKinley Swindell | Game Developer & Artist
channel.description: Recent content in development on Aaron McKinley Swindell | Game Developer & Artist

item.title: difficulty setting and play time integration
item.description: reintroduced the coding for difficulty setting and programmed a play time clock, so that I can finally see how long the gameplay itself is added the ticker to the menu and save file displays, although doing so required rebuilding a bit of the player’s prefab and animator graph.

item.title: impatient persistence
item.description: ended up restoring the project so it will be ready to go on monday

item.title: swapped scripting backend
item.description: what a rough day i remember it being tricky to go back and forth between scripting backend types (mono, IL2CPP) and needing the internet to do so, but I don’t recall having so many problems!

item.title: operation: paper push
item.description: no, seriously… i think this might help all of it needs to be done anyhow mayhap a month of dreary upkeep and a return to the masses of the online roleplayers be just what the doctor ordered i should real quick build a three kit kill version for test play during this time, the level progression values as is are definitely off-putting

item.title: data safety form complete
item.description: i managed to complete Google Play’s data safety form within a day, despite my initial expectations of its difficulty. in the end, it was just a matter of hunkering down and doing it.

item.title: conclusion of operation: octo-squid
item.description: i am formally declaring (announcing?) the conclusion of operation: octo-squid. while the operation’s primary objectives will remain in place, i feel that the short-term goal the regimen was put in place to achieve has been accomplished for the time being.

item.title: hiatus drawing to a close
item.description: i can feel the pangs of art beginning to return after a month or so of respite. i think i shall try to ease myself back into the actual creative parts by working on some practical aspects, that have been neglected as of late, to begin.

item.title: with the cadence of peter lorre
item.description: what feels like an endless endeavour is slowly grinding along. better late than never, at least that’s what they say. finally published the second demo to the Google Play app store for internal testing phase 2.

item.title: mildly winning
item.description: so, i didn’t do anything today, but the rest of the week has been most productive! i’m talking big bugs with single lines; it feels like the home stretch, but honestly it looks halfway there.
